I've played this game dozens of times and it is easily one, if not the best story driven first person shooter ever created(I put it on par with System Shock 2 and Deus Ex 1). It's so good that I was ashamed never owning it "officially", so I bought it during the sale to do the game justice. If you haven't played it yet, get it. I love this game even after all these years. The gunplay, the engine, the story, the game feels "fun" playing and is still worthy of a purchase. The only downside of owning and playing through the game is, you're gonna develop a small vendetta against Gaben for still no releasing Episode 3 to date. You gotta believe man.
Love it !!!! i mean come on its half life what do you expect!!!!!!

Amazing game! Personally, my favorite game of all time. It goes above and beyond the original, improving on many things. The storyline is unique and interesting and considering its from 2004, the graphics aren't that bad. I would highly recommend it to anyone who liked the first game or who likes valve games or who just likes games in general. I've played through it countless times and it still never gets old.

To be frank there are some downsides to the game. I sometimes found myself looking at walkthroughs of this game because I couldn't find a ladder or a path that advanced me through the next section of the main story. The abstract graphics appear unprofessional compared to today's modern games and can be understandably underappreciated by today's youth, who are more in favor of great display during gameplay. However, you have to give credit that this 2004 game has one of the best storylines ever. The plot is ingenious and contains smooth transitions, and it is a successful sequel to the first Half Life. This game is like the oldies, where a great story was the key to a game's success. In fact, it remains true today -- Storyline = Success. In short, the pros outweigh the cons. No wonder why Half Life 3 was such a hype.

If I were to put all the hours into how long I've played Half Life 2, on top of what Steam shows, before I even used Steam and on my Xbox-360, there would surely be over one-hundred twenty hours (give or take) in just Half Life 2 alone. Why? It does everything right in what a FPS game needs. Many nuanced details, simple but oddly rewarding little puzzles as you pass through the many environments, the environments themselves, all strung together as you see just about everything City 17 has to offer. Between run down slums, abandoned industrial parks, a country side with spits of run down buildings in the distance, radiated rivers, giant bug infested shores, head crabs and zombies coming out of the wood work all along the way and a physics engine which even today rivals modern gaming. On top of all that, the story which goes almost untold from the silent protaganist, Gordan Freeman, who in all honesty is about as lost to the happenings of the world as the player is. Only slivers of clues and a very indirect method of story telling always seems to provide just enough to keep people coming back for more.

Edit: Weapon variety. You eventually have something suited for every situation you find yourself in, assuming you've explored the environment and scrounged around for ammo. A fast firing SMG, the trusty little pistol, laser guided rockets, the loud and certainly power Combine Assault Rifle and some other rather unique weapons to the Half Life universe. Such as ant-lion lure, a Zero-Point Energy Field Manipulator AKA the Gravity Gun and of course a crow bar used for everything but it's intended use. Weapon variety is one of the things that keeps this game fresh like a jar of unusually old pickles with a sweet crunchy taste that have undeniably aged well in their, what can only be known as, a secret goo.

These days, the graphics are clearly aging, but retain a certain quality that is undeniable. Though a few bugs and glitches still exist in the game, at this point, you would have to try to cause a glitch to happen. But all in all, this is one of the most polished games you can run across from the mid 2000's, along with it's two following episodes. Along with that, the only way you wouldn't be able to play Half Life 2 on it's top graphics is if you PC is from 2007 or has spam bursting out of the hard disk drive and spilling across your motherboard.

I honestly can't give any good negative to this game. It was a sublime experience back when it released and to this day, remains so. The gameplay remains smooth as can be and continues being one of those gems many other developers can only dream of. If there is a downside to this game, the only one I can really bring out is the AI is plain and simply old. It's not bad and can be challenging enough, but to any vertern FPS gamer of this modern day, it will come across as a little dumb, but that said, the AI won't hold back just how good Half Life 2 is.

So did I have fun? You can bet your bottom dollar I had fun. Will you? Of course! You can typically get all the Half Life games for dirt cheap most of the time and when it's on sale, you can get them for just under $5(USD). I guarentee, it's one of the best purchases you'll make in gaming for a long time to come.

P.S.: I'm wearing rose colored glasses when it comes to this game, so my opinion is cleary biased.

Es y será mi juego favorito. Todos podemos ponernos mal por la falta del último episodio. Dicen que la esperanza muere al último jajaja. Pero es un excelente juego que se puede jugar una y otra vez.

Gráficamente toda una revolución en su día, tanto, que hoy se sigue viendo realmente bien. Continúa la excelente historia del primer Half-Life, pegando un cambio totalmente descabellado, que de alguna manera, logra encajar con el estilo de la saga.

So boring. The story sucks, nearly nothing is explained. You are supposed to accept characters you don't really even know as your long lost companions that just love you so dearly. All of the diversity of aliens from HL1 is gone. You literally just fight soldiers and zombies. To me it felt more like a random shooter that is only called Half Life 2 because they took some characters and a few tiny pieces from Half Life 1. Terrible. I am glad I only payed $0.75 for it. I kept waiting for it to get better, it just never came.

Half life 2 , el mitico half life 2... llevaba tiempo queriendo comprarlo ya que juegué el 1 hace tan solo unos años (si hace unos años , cuando me dio por jugarlo) y la verdad es que me gusto bastante , estube viciado todo el día a pesar de los graficos me hizo engancharme (como buen vidoejuego que es) la historia , el misterio de black mesa, por que Gordon Freman estaba involucrado en ese instante , en el momento equivocado , eso era lo que me atrajo del 1 y desaba jugar este "MITO" de videojuego y aunque HL2 me ha gustado como juego (shooter, fisicas, niveles y ambientación) no se me ha hecho tan interesante como el primero. Los niveles estan muy bien hechos y usan las fisicas (que era lo que supongo que ese entonces era la novedad , las fisicas y los scripts ) y estan muy bien pero esa intriga , ese misterio que daba el primero junto a las mecanicas era tremendo. Este sin embargo se me ha hecho un juego que va años despues de los acontecimientos de black mesa (lo cual ya pierde esa intriga de que paso alli, cosa que se resuelve en el 1) y este se dedica a ponernos en la piel de : Coge esta lancha y ve al punto A a buscar a fulanito, coge este coche y ve al punto B, y ahora ve a  al punto C y fin . NO critico la linealidad ya que como he dicho los niveles son tremendos y como en el uno me he viciado todo el día XD , me lo abre pasado en 4-6 horas facil (en steam pone 3 o así por que lo jugué con el mod update y no cuenta las horas en el original) pero la historia no me ha parecido lo que era el 1 y el final o lo dejan lo mas abierto posible (para los episodios) o yo no me e enterado de nada.

Si os ha gustado el  1 comprad este , lo recomiendo, te lo pasas en grande  pero para mi con lo que habia leido por internet pensaba que iba a estar mucho mejor (no he jugado los episodios, por lo que solo estoy analizando el juego original).

PD: Seguramente para el año que se hizo este juego era la hostia pero yo venia con la premisa del 1 y que este era el culmen y me en encontrado con un juego, que sí, esta bien, pero no me aporta casi nada (sin hablar del final que  a decir verdad no entendí nada).

I remember reading about the development of Half-Life 2 before its release in 2004. I was so excited for the sequel of my favorite game, Half-Life. It did not disappoint.

Today I can see how the game has aged, mostly visually, as the story holds up as being unique.

Every few years I play through HL2 again to relive the story, but keep in mind this is a linear, narrative type game. It is not open world or without loading screens as most games were in the 2000s.

Half-Life 2 is a must for most people who like video games to experience at least once and will always be a classic.
